doc.after: While The Histories were occasionally criticized in antiquity,[39] modern historians and philosophers generally take a positive view.[40] Despite the controversy,[41][42][43] Herodotus still serves as the primary, and often only, source for events in the Greek world, Persian Empire, and the region generally in the two centuries leading up until his own day.[16][44] Herodotus, like many ancient historians, preferred an element of show[45][46] to purely analytic history, aiming to give pleasure with âexciting events, great dramas, bizarre exotica.â [47] As such, certain passages[48][49] have been the subject of controversy and even some doubt, both in antiquity and today.[50][51][52][53][54][55][56][57][58]
